resources.string: The Giving Kitchen is building a restaurant community where crisis is met with compassion and care, and anyone can be a hero.
Are you or someone you know a restaurant worker in crisis? Learn more about what Giving Kitchen can do to assist.
Donate, Volunteer, or Partner:\nThree Ways to Get Involved &\u0020 Make a Difference.
From educating the public about our program services to providing special event support, GK would not exist without the dedication of our champion volunteers. Join the team!
Would you like to become part of Giving Kitchen\'s social service or community resource referral program? We\'d love to hear from you!
A group of people eating salad together
A meeting where people listen to a team leader
Through our Crisis Grants, we cover the cost of living expenses for restaurant workers impacted by
You can start an assistance inquiry for yourself, or for someone else.
SafetyNet is a network of local resources providing aid. If the Giving Kitchen is unable to assist, these local heroes are here to help.
Join our Restaurant Workers group on Facebook
Our groups are places to share industry events, community resources (including job postings), and best practices.
Our groups are places to share industry events, community resources (including job postings), and best practices.
Thanks for your interest in volunteering!\nPlease fill this out and we\'ll contact you soon about upcoming opportunities!

The mission of the Giving Kitchen is to provide emergency assistance to restaurant workers through financial support and a network of community resources.

While much of our energy, time, and resources are focused on GK signature events like Team Hidi, The Pinky, and Multiply Joy, we recognize that the core strength of our organization lies in support from our industry, supplier partners, and community advocates. We also know there are many causes worthy of your support. By focusing our resources in a few areas, we feel our impact to the restaurant community is much greater.

We hate to put you "through the hoops" whenyou are eager to partner with us, but this system helps us immensely with our decision-making andrecord-keeping process. We appreciate your commitment and timein supporting our efforts to make effective decisions toward the bettermentof our industry.

Our Crisis Grants program currently serve restaurant workers living in Metro Atlanta, Athens, Columbus, and Rome. Grants are awarded based on the restaurant worker\'s financial need as well as a set of criteria according to the type of crisis. Most often, our financial assistance covers the cost of rent and utilities, paid directly to the service provider(s). Applications are reviewed by Giving Kitchen staff and a review committee consisting of GK board members. The average time to fully process an application from beginning to end is three weeks. \n\nPlease note: we do not pay medical expenses.
